source_sentence: 金色童子因緣經卷第一
translation: Sutra on the Causes and Conditions of the Golden Boy, Volume 1

source_sentence: 譯經三藏朝散大夫試鴻
translation: Tantra Translation Tripiṭaka, Chaosan Dafu, and Sihong

source_sentence: 臚卿光梵大師賜紫沙門
translation: Vaiśravaṇa, bestowed by the great minister Guangfan

source_sentence: 臣惟淨等奉　詔譯
translation: I, Wejing, and others, have been instructed to translate this document.

source_sentence: 如是隨聞：尊者大迦葉已趣圓常，尊者阿難具大威德有大智慧，與尊者舍利子等無有異，悲心如佛普攝一切，能於國城聚落方處，隨彼彼處，以勝方便調伏化度一切眾生。
translation: Thus it is heard: "Venerable Mahākāśyapa has arrived at perfect permanence, Venerable Ānanda has great authority and wisdom, is not different from Venerable Śāriputra, has compassion like a Buddha who universally includes all things, and can go from one country and city to another, using excellent methods to tame and liberate all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 乃至後時，廣為教化俱胝百千諸眾生故，宣說正法而雨甘露，灌注心頂，周遍廣嚴大城菴羅樹園，皆作利樂。
translation: Eventually, for the widespread purpose of teaching and transforming a hundred thousand sentient beings, he explained the right teaching and poured sweet dew into the tops of their minds, which then spread throughout the vast and ornate city of Anāthapiṇḍada's Park and made them all happy.

source_sentence: 是時，王舍大城有一商主，其名日照，居處城中，財寶富饒眷屬熾盛，其廣其大攝聚增多，與毘沙門天王等無有異；以富盛故，娶於上族，相與嬉戲遊止娛樂，久無嗣息，長者眷屬心懷渴慕極生憂惱。
translation: At the time, there was a merchant named Rizhao who lived in the great city of Rājagṛha and had wealthy and prosperous retinues that were as vast and numerous as those of Vaiśravaṇa; because of their wealth, they married members of a superior clan, played with each other, stayed for fun, and had no successors for a long time, and the longing of their retinues caused them to become extremely distressed.

source_sentence: 是時，忉利天中有一天子具福威德，天報將盡五衰相現，然其樂欲觀佛出世，乃至涅槃莊嚴等事，求於人中相續受生。
translation: At the time, there was a celestial in the Heaven of the Thirty-three gods who was blessed with great virtue and whose heavenly retribution was about to end and whose five signs of decay were manifesting, but he wanted to observe the Buddha's appearance in the world and even his adornment of nirvāṇa, and he sought to be reborn continuously among humans.

source_sentence: 爾時帝釋天主，觀彼天子將其謝滅，樂欲觀佛莊嚴等事，欲於人中相續受生。
translation: It was then that the lord of Indra observed that god's son had passed away and was happy to observe the Buddha's adornment and other things, and he wanted to be reborn continuously among humans.

source_sentence: 知已，乃謂彼天子言：「汝若樂欲人中生者，汝今應知，王舍城中有一商主其名日照，而彼妻室堪汝托陰。」
translation: Knowing this, he said to that celestial, "If you're delighted in wanting to be born among humans, you should know now that there's a merchant in Rājagṛha whose name is Rizhao and whose wife and family you can trust with your soul."

source_sentence: 天子答言：「我昔曾聞，彼商主者於佛法中而無淨信。」
translation: The prince replied, "I once heard that that merchant owner had no pure faith in the Buddha's teaching."

source_sentence: 帝釋復言：「仁者！
translation: Tissadatta then replied, "Sir!

source_sentence: 今當如我所作，我能令彼日照商主於佛法中深生淨信。」
translation: Now, just as I have done, I can cause that merchant Sunshiners to have deep, pure faith in the Buddha's teaching."

source_sentence: 天子白言：「如天主語，唯然受教。
translation: The prince said, "As the lord of the gods said, I'll accept your teaching.

source_sentence: 若彼商主與其妻室，乃至盡壽歸依三寶，我當從命托彼陰中。」
translation: If that merchant and his wife and family were to spend their whole lives relying on the Three Treasures, I would take refuge in their aggregates for my life."

source_sentence: 是時，帝釋天主從天中隱，即於王舍大城日照商主舍中，處空而住，以其帝釋天主色相威神，周匝是舍有微妙光，而為照耀。
translation: Śakra Devānām-Indra then withdrew from the heavens and stayed in the house of Śāriputra, the merchant lord of Rājagṛha, in the great city of Rājagṛha, where he was standing in the sky, shining a subtle light with the dignified appearance of Śakra Devānām-Indra that surrounded his house.

source_sentence: 時日照商主見是微妙光明照已，深生奇異，舉熙怡目周遍四方，審諦觀察乃見帝釋天主勝相，即時頭面禮奉雙足，作是白言：「天主！
translation: Seeing this subtle light shining, the merchant lord Sunshine was deeply amazed, and when he raised his eyes and looked around in all directions, he carefully observed and saw the distinguished features of Indra the god, saluted him with his head and feet, and said, "Lord of the gods!

source_sentence: 我於今日快得善利，汝天聖尊降于小舍，當何教令？
translation: Today, I've quickly attained a good benefit. What instructions will you give when the noble one of the gods comes down to this small house?

source_sentence: 吉祥勝事何所成辦？」
translation: What is the accomplishment of this auspicious and excellent deed?"

source_sentence: 天主答言：「商主！
translation: The lord of the gods replied, "Master merchant!

source_sentence: 知汝無子，汝若希求有子息者，汝與妻室從今已往乃至盡壽，應發淨心歸依三寶，當生貴子。」
translation: Knowing that you are childless, if you wish to have children, you and your wife and family should from now until the end of your life give rise to the Three Treasures with a pure heart and return to them, and they will give birth to a noble son."

source_sentence: 是時，日照商主聞是語已，心意泰然，踊躍歡喜，作是白言：「天主！
translation: Upon hearing these words, the merchant Sunshine was overcome with joy and happiness, and he said, "Lord of the gods!

source_sentence: 我等今者如尊教令，從今已往乃至盡壽，同己妻室皆發淨心歸依三寶。」
translation: Now, as Your Holiness has instructed, from now on until the end of our lives, we and our wives and families will all develop a pure faith and rely on the Three Treasures."

source_sentence: 爾時，帝釋天主為其日照商主及彼妻室，開發淨信歸依三寶已，即於王舍城中隱而不現，還復忉利天中彼天子宮，現住其前，為彼天子一一廣宣如上事相。
translation: After the Śakra Devānām-Indra and his wife and family had developed a pure faith in the Three Treasures, he withdrew from the city of Rājagṛha, returned to the palace of that celestial in the Heaven of Thirty-three, stayed there, and explained the above things for each of those celestials.

source_sentence: 乃至其後，而彼天子於彼天中謝滅天報，即於王舍城中日照商主之妻托陰胎藏。
translation: Eventually, after he had extinguished the divine retribution in that heaven, that celestial son went to the womb of the merchant's wife, Rissho, in Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 聖子入胎，奇相斯現，時商主妻身中自然具有最上色相威光，悅意香風時來吹觸。
translation: When the noble son entered the womb, this marvelous feature appeared, and the merchant's wife naturally had a radiance of the highest color and shape in her body, with a pleasant fragrant breeze blowing at regular intervals.

source_sentence: 是時，國城賢女之家皆生智者，復有五種獨異之相。
translation: At the time, wise men were born in the house of a good woman in the country, and they had five other distinctive features.

source_sentence: 何等為五？
translation: What are the five?

source_sentence: 一者、能知人所愛樂；二者、能知人不愛樂；三者、知時；四者、能知時中微細；五者、能知入胎藏事。
translation: 1. can know what people like; 2. can know what people don't like; 3. knows the time; 4. can know the subtleties of the time; and 5. can know about entering the womb.

source_sentence: 入胎藏事者，謂入胎時能知所生是男是女，若是男者於胎藏中依右而住，若是女者於胎藏中依左而住。
translation: "Entering the womb conceals things, which is to say that when he enters the womb, he can know whether he's born a boy or a girl, and if he's a boy, he'll abide to the right in the womb conceals, and if he's a girl, he'll abide to the left in the womb conceals.

source_sentence: 是時，其妻心生歡喜，謂夫主言：「君應當知，我觀于今所懷聖子，胎藏分位漸增成長，依右而住，其後當生決定是男。」
translation: His wife then rejoiced and said to the husband, "You should know that I've observed the noble son I'm carrying now, whose fetal position is gradually increasing and growing, and who lives to the right, and who will be born a definite male."

source_sentence: 夫主聞已，加復欣悅。
translation: After hearing this, the man was further delighted.

source_sentence: 時商主妻其身輕舉，乃舒右臂，即作是言：「我久時中希求子息，願見子面，今所懷子，若生未生我今宜應營作福事。」
translation: The merchant's wife then lifted her body, stretched out her right arm, and said, "For a long time, I've longed for the respiration of my child and wished to see his face; now, if the child I'm carrying were born or not born, I would undertake a task of merit."

source_sentence: 即召主執：「聚以珍財隨力行施，令我種族久住昌盛。
translation: He then summons the master to take charge of him, "Gather valuable possessions and give them with all your might so that my people will live and prosper for a long time.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 我於前世，若少若多隨行布施作福事已，於今生中施名不墜，亦復生生隨逐不失。」
translation: In a previous life, whether small or large, I performed a meritorious act of generosity; in this life, my reputation for generosity won't fall away, and I'll be reborn again, following it without losing it."

source_sentence: 爾時，商主之妻胎藏漸成，預知其相，處于高閣安隱之所，善養護之。
translation: At the time, the merchant's wife, whose womb was gradually forming, foreknew its features, placed it in a high, quiet place, and nurtured it well.

source_sentence: 寒即隨寒而妙資養，熱即隨熱而妙資養，方藥攝治飲食順度，苦醋甘辛鹹淡之味悉無過極，六味調勻離諸愆失。
translation: She follows cold with wonderful nourishment, follows heat with wonderful nourishment, prepares medicines to manage food and drink in ways that are compliant, tastes bitter and vinegar, sweet and pungent, and salty and mild, and has no excesses or deficiencies in the blending of the six flavors.

source_sentence: 復以瓔珞莊嚴其身，猶如天女，而常遊戲歡喜園中，若座若床高低隨易，或履地時無諸硬澁，亦不少聞不悅意聲。
translation: She also adorns her body with jewelry, just like a goddess, and always roams around in the joyful garden, where her seat or bed is raised or lowered as she wishes, and when she steps on the ground there's no hardness, and she doesn't often hear disagreeable sounds.

source_sentence: 乃至其後胎中分位成熟圓滿，或滿八月、或滿九月，生一童子，色相殊麗人所樂觀，端正嚴好支體成滿，身有金色光相艶赫，諸分具足悅目適心。
translation: It's not long before the partial stage of maturation in the womb is complete, and then, at the end of the eighth or ninth month, a child is born with a beautiful appearance that's well-liked by people, a body with a perfectly proportioned, beautiful limb, and a golden radiance that's brilliant and well-appointed, and it's pleasing to the eyes and mind.

source_sentence: 眾共瞻覩，金黃色衣自然覆體，旃檀香風遍觸其身，口中復出優鉢花香。
translation: The crowd sees him, and his golden-colored robes naturally cover his body, the fragrant wind of sandalwood touches him, and the fragrance of the upright flower comes out of his mouth.

source_sentence: 童子生時，長者舍中又復雨眾妙衣，所雨之衣皆悉金色，迦尼迦花繽紛而墜，現如是等希有瑞相廣大圓成。
translation: When the boy was born, another multitude of marvelous robes rained down from the elders' residence, and all of the robes rained down were gold in color, with the flowers of the kanaka blossoming in profusion, giving rise to such rare and wonderfully beautiful appearances that were vast and complete.

source_sentence: 是時，日照商主與其妻室、并諸眷屬，見是事已，咸生驚異。
translation: When the merchant owner Rizhao, his wife, his household, and their retinues saw this, they were all astonished.

source_sentence: 于時商主，即出其舍住於門側，自外而觀愈增欣躍，見是相已，乃作是念：「童子誕生誠多增長，心生最上最極歡喜。」
translation: The merchant then left his dwelling and stayed near the door, looking out and becoming increasingly elated as he saw these features, and he thought, "The birth of this child has sincerely increased, and my heart is most excellent and overjoyed."

source_sentence: 還入舍中，乃至其後見是童子，色相殊麗端正嚴好，踊躍歡喜，說伽陀曰：「快哉！
translation: He went back into his house, and even afterward, when he saw this boy with beautiful features and a fine, upright appearance, he rejoiced and said to the gods, "How wonderful!

source_sentence: 我今得善利。
translation: Now, I've gotten a good benefit.

source_sentence: 快哉！
translation: What a joy!

source_sentence: 意願已圓成。
translation: My wish has been fulfilled.

source_sentence: 福威德子今日生，　　是故我心大歡喜。」
translation: Today, the son of merit and virtue has arisen, and so my heart is greatly rejoiced."

source_sentence: 說伽陀已，以歡喜故，復出家中殊妙衣服，普施沙門及婆羅門、孤露貧者、宗里、親屬，以營福事。
translation: After speaking about the Gadhātu, he rejoiced and then gave out his household's marvelous clothing to monks, priests, orphans, the poor, clans, and relatives for a good cause.

source_sentence: 爾時，童子生後已經二十一日，廣為修營眾福事已。
translation: It was then twenty-one days after the boy's birth, and he had been extensively cultivating the merits of many things.

source_sentence: 親族共議宜當立名，有親者言：「今此童子身有金色艶赫光明，諸親今當為此童子立名金色。」
translation: When the clansmen agreed that it would be a good idea to name him, one of the relatives said, "Now that this boy has a golden, brilliant body, the relatives will name this boy Golden."

source_sentence: 眾議已定，于是乃名金色童子。
translation: After the discussion was settled, the boy was then called the Golden Boy.

source_sentence: 是時，商主即為金色童子選八女人命為其母：二為養育；二為洗濯；二為乳哺；二為戲翫。
translation: The merchant then chose eight women to be the golden boy's mothers: two to nurture, two to wash, two to nurse, and two to play with.

source_sentence: 由是速疾長養成立，如淨蓮花淤泥中出，漸當教習童子藝能，若書、若算，及諸事業：一為安布書算印記；二為安布諸所用具；三布衣服；四安布馬；五布乘輿；六布珍寶；七布童男；八布童女。
translation: Thus, he quickly and long nourishes and establishes them like pure lotus flowers emerging from the mud, gradually teaching the boy skills such as writing, arithmetic, and various undertakings: first, to distribute writing and arithmetic seals; second, to distribute implements; third, to distribute clothing; fourth, to distribute horses; fifth, to distribute carriages; sixth, to distribute treasures; seven, to distribute boy children; and eighth, to distribute girl children.

source_sentence: 如是八種廣安布已，悉令觀矚驗其所好。
translation: After these eight kinds of extensive layouts, they all make him look at them and examine their preferences.

source_sentence: 而後，童子藝業成立語言明利，信心清淨志意賢善，自利利他具大威德，善修悲行成就法欲，愛念眾生智慧明了，善解文論，如是童子功業圓備。
translation: Afterward, the boy's art is established, his speech is clear and sharp, his faith is purified, his intentions are good, he possesses great authority for the benefit of self and others, he cultivates compassionate behavior and accomplishes his desire for the Dharma, he's mindful of sentient beings, his wisdom is clear, and he well understands the treatises and theories, so the boy's accomplishments are complete.

source_sentence: 商主爾時作是思惟：「今此童子福威德力，衣服財寶一切圓具，然我不知此福威德其何所因？
translation: The merchant then had this thought, "Now, this boy's merits and virtue are such that his clothing and wealth are perfectly complete, but I don't know what the cause of his merits and virtue is.

source_sentence: 豈非以我歸依三寶勝威力故，此子誕生獲是勝福？」
translation: Is it not because of my refuge in the Three Treasures and their outstanding power that this child was born with such excellent fortune?"

source_sentence: 其後商主於佛法中轉生淨信，依時如應作諸佛事。
translation: Subsequently, the merchant owner developed pure faith in the Buddha's teachings and performed all the Buddha-works as he should have done at the time.

source_sentence: 爾時，王舍城中有一商主名曰離垢，經泛大海獲利圓成安隱而還，為佛世尊及千二百五十苾芻眷屬，普遍清淨飯供已訖，一一苾芻復以三衣而為布施。
translation: At the time, there was a merchant in Rājagṛha named Vimalakīrti who had gone through the vast ocean, reaped the benefits, completed his retreat, and returned to the Buddha, the Bhagavān, and 1,250 members of his retinue, and after they had made a general and pure meal offering, each of the retinue then gave alms with three garments.

source_sentence: 于是，離垢商主淨信之名充遍世間，咸讚是言：「今此商主善為商導，涉渡大海果利無虛，而能於佛法中廣作勝事。」
translation: The Venerable Merchant Licchavi's reputation for pure faith then filled the world, and everyone praised him, saying, "Now, this merchant is a good merchant guide, whose wade across the ocean brings rewards that are not in vain, and who is able to do excellent work in the Buddha's teaching."

source_sentence: 時，日照商主聞是言已，願相習斆，乃起是念：「我若同此涉渡大海無難還者，願我當以佛諸聲聞弟子之眾，乃至遍住此閻浮提，以佛教勅聚為一會。
translation: After hearing those words, the merchant owner Rizhao vowed to cultivate his skills and then had this thought, "If I were to wade across the ocean with him without difficulty, may I bring a multitude of the Buddha's disciples, even śrāvakas, to stay here in Jambudvīpa and gather them into a single congregation with the Buddha's commands.

source_sentence: 我當悉以上妙飲食，遍供給已，復於一一苾芻，各以上妙三衣周行給施。」
translation: I will make universal offerings of fine foods and drink, and then I will give each of those monks the three fine garments that they wear around the house."

source_sentence: 作是念已，具以上事告語其妻，妻即答言：「夫主！
translation: After he had thought this, he told his wife about all of the above, and she replied, "Master!

source_sentence: 若能有其勢用，隨汝所願必能成辦。」
translation: If you can give it momentum, it will surely come true according to your wishes."

source_sentence: 是時日照商主，即於王舍城中，三復振鈴遍警告已，乃與五百商人眷屬登涉大海，既已得渡安處彼方。
translation: The merchant owner Rizhao then went to the city of Rājagṛha and, after warning him by ringing his bell three times, ascended to the ocean with his five hundred merchant followers, and once they had crossed it, they were safely placed there.

source_sentence: 時佛世尊已入涅槃，其後復聞尊者大迦葉亦入涅槃。
translation: After the Bhagavān had entered nirvāṇa, he also heard that Venerable Mahākāśyapa had also entered nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 乃至後時，金色童子於竹林精舍，聞一苾芻誦無常偈曰：「若晝若夜中，　　或行或復住，　如大河迅流，　　念念無停止。
translation: It wasn't long after that that the golden boy was in the bamboo grove monastery and heard a monk recite a verse about impermanence, saying, "Whether it's day or night, whether he's walking or standing again, it's like a great river flowing quickly, and his mindfulness never stops.

source_sentence: 寢宿過是夜，　　壽命隨減少，　猶如少水魚，　　斯何有其樂？
translation: After lying awake for a night, their life span decreases as they go, just like a fish with little water; how could there be happiness in that?

source_sentence: 此色相衰朽，　　病集即破壞，　如羊被殺時，　　命去死不久。
translation: "When this form decays, it collects disease and is destroyed, like a sheep when it's killed, and its life disappears soon after death.

source_sentence: 此身非久住，　　地等六大成，　譬如曠野居，　　無門無關閉。
translation: This body doesn't last long, and the six elements of earth and so forth are formed like a man living in the wilderness with no gate or door to close.

source_sentence: 此身何所樂？
translation: What's the joy of this body?

source_sentence: 穢惡眾盈流，　病苦所縈纏，　　老死常驚怖。
translation: They are full of filth and evil, are tethered by illness and pain, and are always frightened by old age and death.

source_sentence: 今此穢惡身，　　病集即離散，　得勝寂靜時，　　乃最上安樂。」
translation: Now, when this body of defilements and evils is free of the accumulation of illnesses and becomes tranquil, it's the greatest happiness."

source_sentence: 是時，金色童子聞是偈已，於生死中極生厭離，欣樂涅槃廣多讚歎，即時禮奉彼苾芻已，乃發問言：「向聞聖者所誦偈句，云何語邪？」
translation: After hearing this verse, the golden boy became extremely disillusioned with birth-and-death, rejoiced in nirvāṇa, and praised it profusely. After prostrating himself to that monk, he asked, "What did the sage say when he heard that verse recited by him?"

source_sentence: 苾芻答言：「汝今當知，此是佛語。」
translation: The monk replied, "Now, you should know that this is the Buddha's teaching."

source_sentence: 童子聞已，於佛法中益生淨信，乃發諦誠樂欲出家。
translation: After hearing this, the boy's pure faith in the Buddha's teaching grew, and he aroused a sincere desire to leave home.

source_sentence: 轉復肅恭於苾芻前，再伸拜奉白言：「聖者！
translation: He then reverently approached the monk, extended his prostrations, and said, "Sage!

source_sentence: 我今樂欲清淨出家，惟願聖者，悲愍攝受令得出家。」
translation: Now, I would like to leave home purely, but may the noble one compassionately accept me and allow me to leave home."

source_sentence: 苾芻答言：「汝欲出家，父母聽不？」
translation: The monk replied, "Would your parents listen to you if you wanted to leave home?"

source_sentence: 童子答言：「未承其命。」
translation: The boy answered, "I haven't yet accepted his order."

source_sentence: 苾芻告言：「汝今宜應往白父母，若其聽許，乃可出家。」
translation: The monk told him, "Now, you should go to your parents and tell them that if they approve, you can leave home."

source_sentence: 童子復言：「如尊所教。」
translation: The boy again said, "As the venerable has taught you."

source_sentence: 是時，金色童子深厭生死極大怖畏，志樂出家，即還自舍詣其母所，拜奉雙足前白母言：「願母知我，我今樂欲清淨出家，於佛法中修正法律，惟垂聽許。」
translation: Then, deeply disillusioned with birth and death and greatly frightened, the golden boy desired to leave home. He returned to his mother's house, bowed his head at her feet, and said to her, "May your mother know that I would like to purify my mind and leave home and revise the Dharma among the Buddhadharmas, so please grant me permission."

source_sentence: 母聞言已，悚然驚懼拊膝傷歎，謂其子言：「唯汝一子我所愛念，如其意樂百種依隨，云何汝今捨我出家？」
translation: When she heard what he said, his mother was frightened and frightened, patted her knees and lamented, and said to her son, "You're the only son I've ever loved and respected, and I've enjoyed following him in a hundred ways according to his wishes.

source_sentence: 子白母言：「母今當知，諸有恩愛決定離散，願母于今聽我出家修正法律。」
translation: The son said to his mother, "Now, you must know, Mother, that all your loving friends are definitely separated, and I hope you'll listen to me leaving home now and correct the Dharma."

source_sentence: 母聞言已，逼惱之心，轉復增極哽咽垂涕，復謂子言：「子今當知，勿於我前三復斯說，無令熱血自口而流。」
translation: After hearing those words, the mother's distress increased and she became increasingly choked up and weeping, and she again said to the son, "Now, son, you should know better than to tell me this three times, so that no hot blood will flow from your mouth."

source_sentence: 其母即時乃自思忖：「若今如是畢竟不能止其意樂，宜設方便以解其心。」
translation: His mother then considered to herself, "After all, this won't stop his aspirations; it's better to devise a way to relieve his mind."

source_sentence: 乃復謂言：「童子！
translation: She then also said, "Boy!

source_sentence: 汝父淨信，於佛法中廣營勝事，已涉大海非久即還，汝今宜應俟父歸復，父必有命聽汝出家。」
translation: Your father is a pure believer who has devoted much effort to the Buddha's teaching and will return soon after wading through the ocean, so now you should wait for your father to return, for he will order you to leave home."

source_sentence: 是時，童子於母孝奉即自思惟：「我若重復啟言陳告，必令我母極生逼惱，我宜從命俟父還家。」
translation: The boy then devoted himself to his mother's filial piety and thought, "If I were to reveal this again, it would cause my mother great distress, so I should obey my father's order and return home."

source_sentence: 于是童子默然受教。
translation: The boy then quietly accepted the teaching.

source_sentence: 爾時，金色童子以其色相嚴好殊麗，凡於四衢經遊出處，眾共瞻覩觀者無厭。
translation: At the time, the golden boy's appearance was so beautiful that it was endlessly admired by people who wandered through the four streets and went out to see it.

source_sentence: 時童子母復作是念：「我子端嚴色相殊麗，眾所愛樂，然我之子於世間法深生厭背，以是緣故心常懷疑，此子欻然捨我出家。
translation: The boy's mother then also thought, "My son's adornment and beautiful appearance are loved by many people, but my son is deeply disillusioned with worldly dharmas, and for this reason he always doubts it in his mind.

source_sentence: 我今應當隨逐防衛，子若去之後當生苦。」
translation: Now, I should follow and defend him, for if he leaves, suffering will result."

source_sentence: 金色童子因緣經卷第一
translation: Sutra on the Causes and Conditions of the Golden Boy, Volume 1
